quote: When the people who are responsible for our country ask you a direct question, I expect them to accept a direct answer, not to be blackballed because you are telling the truth.
author: Eartha Kitt

quote: The truth is that life is delicious, horrible, charming, frightful, sweet, bitter, and that is everything.
author: Anatole France

quote: People will generally accept facts as truth only if the facts agree with what they already believe.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: My mother taught me that when you stand in the truth and someone tells a lie about you, don't fight it.
author: Whitney Houston

quote: Gossip is called gossip because it's not always the truth.
author: Justin Timberlake

quote: Without accepting the fact that everything changes, we cannot find perfect composure. But unfortunately, although it is true, it is difficult for us to accept it. Because we cannot accept the truth of transience, we suffer.
author: Shunryu Suzuki

quote: Son, always tell the truth. Then you'll never have to remember what you said the last time.
author: Sam Rayburn

quote: Don't worry over what the newspapers say. I don't. Why should anyone else? I told the truth to the newspaper correspondents - but when you tell the truth to them they are at sea.
author: William Howard Taft

quote: Truth, when not sought after, rarely comes to light.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quote: Whoever is detected in a shameful fraud is ever after not believed even if they speak the truth.
author: Phaedrus

quote: All the religions of the world, while they may differ in other respects, unitedly proclaim that nothing lives in this world but Truth.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Truth, they say, is but too often in difficulties, but is never finally suppressed.
author: Livy

quote: If the sad truth be known, writers, being the misfits we are, probably ought not to belong to families in the first place. We simply are too self-interested, though we may excuse the flaw by calling it 'focused.'
author: Roger Rosenblatt

quote: Some people have a difficult time facing truth and reality. They prefer to live in a make-believe world, pretending that certain things aren't happening.
author: Joyce Meyer

quote: Expressing truth is hard work.
author: Timothy Noah

quote: I have been known for some time as a person who speaks the truth and speaks it strongly. I have always called a liar a liar and a hypocrite a hypocrite.
author: Cindy Sheehan

quote: I am angry about the mammoth, out-of-control social welfare entitlement programs from Washington, D.C., that were supposed to solve our problems. The obvious truth is these impractical, politically motivated programs have irreparably damaged the fabric of our black society and community.
author: Allen West

quote: The truth is, people don't know me. When people don't know you, they're going to try to get to know you as quickly as possible, because you're now taking the place of somebody that they love dearly, or somebody that they hate sincerely, and so they need to know who you are.
author: Trevor Noah

quote: The opportunity to declare a truth may come when we least expect it. Let us be prepared.
author: Thomas S. Monson

quote: If you see voters as rational, you'll be a terrible politician. People are not wired to be rational. Our brains simply evolved to keep us alive. Brains did not evolve to give us truth. Brains merely give us movies in our minds that keeps us sane and motivated. But none of it is rational or true, except maybe sometimes by coincidence.
author: Scott Adams

quote: I don't want any yes-men around me. I want everybody to tell me the truth even if it costs them their job.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: What a word is truth. Slippery, tricky, unreliable. I tried in these books to tell the truth.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: Above all, I would teach him to tell the truth Truth-telling, I have found, is the key to responsible citizenship. The thousands of criminals I have seen in 40 years of law enforcement have had one thing in common: Every single one was a liar.
author: J. Edgar Hoover

quote: Search for the truth. I tell you things and I always ask you to verify what I say. I told you yesterday that there was an attack and a retreat at Saddam's airport.
author: Mohammed Saeed al-Sahaf

quote: Accuracy of statement is one of the first elements of truth inaccuracy is a near kin to falsehood.
author: Tryon Edwards

quote: When distant and unfamiliar and complex things are communicated to great masses of people, the truth suffers a considerable and often a radical distortion. The complex is made over into the simple, the hypothetical into the dogmatic, and the relative into an absolute.
author: Walter Lippmann

quote: Everything you add to the truth subtracts from the truth.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: The truth is balance. However the opposite of truth, which is unbalance, may not be a lie.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: A lie would have no sense unless the truth were felt dangerous.
author: Alfred Adler

quote: Every great discovery I ever made, I gambled that the truth was there, and then I acted in faith until I could prove its existence.
author: Arthur H. Compton

quote: You must have love as the core it takes courage to be willing to constantly tell the truth to each other and risk letting the relationship go.
author: Kenny Loggins

quote: When I saw corruption, I was forced to find truth on my own. I couldn't swallow the hypocrisy.
author: Barry White

quote: I don't think Bosnia is ready for reconciliation, but I do think it is ready for truth.
author: Paddy Ashdown

quote: The inquiries of the jurist are in truth prosecuted much as inquiry in physic and physiology was prosecuted before observation had taken the place of assumption.
author: Henry James Sumner Maine

quote: It's a great thriller or mystery, but on another level it's a film about the fact that, if you only look at a person through one lens, or only believe what you're told, you can often miss the truth that is staring you in the face.
author: Kevin Spacey

quote: Everybody now admits that apartheid was wrong, and all I did was tell the people who wanted to know where I come from how we lived in South Africa. I just told the world the truth. And if my truth then becomes political, I can't do anything about that.
author: Miriam Makeba

quote: Let us be a little humble let us think that the truth may not perhaps be entirely with us.
author: Jawaharlal Nehru

quote: What I claim is to live to the full the contradiction of my time, which may well make sarcasm the condition of truth.
author: Roland Barthes

quote: The Bible must be considered as the great source of all the truth by which men are to be guided in government as well as in all social transactions.
author: Noah Webster

quote: Truth is not only violated by falsehood it may be equally outraged by silence.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Any fool can tell the truth, but it requires a man of some sense to know how to lie well.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: There is something wonderful in seeing a wrong-headed majority assailed by truth.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: What ever truth drops on it eventually grinds to a powder.
author: Art Blakey

quote: Justice is truth in action.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: If any man seeks for greatness, let him forget greatness and ask for truth, and he will find both.
author: Horace Mann

quote: Doubt is the incentive to truth and inquiry leads the way.
author: Hosea Ballou

quote: Truth is strong, and sometime or other will prevail.
author: Mary Astell

quote: Sure I think it is healthy to speak the truth, and be who you are, and be proud of that.
author: Nathan Lane

quote: Learn what is true in order to do what is right.
author: Thomas Huxley

quote: I always felt that a scientist owes the world only one thing, and that is the truth as he sees it.
author: Hans Eysenck

quote: It is an old maxim of mine that when you have excluded the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: The violinist must possess the poet's gift of piercing the protective hide which grows on propagandists, stockbrokers and slave traders, to penetrate the deeper truth which lies within.
author: Yehudi Menuhin

quote: Who never doubted, never half believed. Where doubt is, there truth is - it is her shadow.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Heresies are experiments in man's unsatisfied search for truth.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Truth emerges more readily from error than from confusion.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Popular opinions, on subjects not palpable to sense, are often true, but seldom or never the whole truth.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: If you ever injected truth into politics you have no politics.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The public will believe anything, so long as it is not founded on truth.
author: Edith Sitwell

quote: Nothing leads the scientist so astray as a premature truth.
author: Jean Rostand

quote: Man's mind is so formed that it is far more susceptible to falsehood than to truth.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: Defending the truth is not something one does out of a sense of duty or to allay guilt complexes, but is a reward in itself.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: There is no original truth, only original error.
author: Gaston Bachelard

quote: Wisdom is found only in truth.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: A petty reason perhaps why novelists more and more try to keep a distance from journalists is that novelists are trying to write the truth and journalists are trying to write fiction.
author: Graham Greene

quote: I never gave anybody hell! I just told the truth and they thought it was hell.
author: Harry S Truman

quote: Lawyers enjoy a little mystery, you know. Why, if everybody came forward and told the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth straight out, we should all retire to the workhouse.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: As Commander in Chief of the United States Military, I will never send our sons and daughters and our brothers and sisters to die in a foreign land without telling the truth about why they're going there.
author: Howard Dean

quote: We should not be so taken up in the search for truth, as to neglect the needful duties of active life; for it is only action that gives a true value and commendation to virtue.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The object of oratory alone in not truth, but persuasion.
author: Thomas Babington Macaulay

quote: Traditional scientific method has always been at the very best, 20 - 20 hindsight. It's good for seeing where you've been. It's good for testing the truth of what you think you know, but it can't tell you where you ought to go.
author: Robert M. Pirsig

quote: Truth, which is important to a scholar, has got to be concrete. And there is nothing more concrete than dealing with babies, burps and bottles, frogs and mud.
author: Jeane Kirkpatrick

quote: The audience is the best judge of anything. They cannot be lied to. Truth brings them closer. A moment that lags - they're gonna cough.
author: Barbra Streisand

quote: We occasionally stumble over the truth but most of us pick ourselves up and hurry off as if nothing had happened.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: He who sees the truth, let him proclaim it, without asking who is for it or who is against it.
author: Henry George

quote: For truth is always strange stranger than fiction.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The American people need to know the truth. The American people need to see the truth. In a democracy, letting the people know the truth is the essence of what it means to be free.
author: Barbara Boxer

quote: Every scientific truth goes through three states: first, people say it conflicts with the Bible; next, they say it has been discovered before; lastly, they say they always believed it.
author: Louis Agassiz

quote: Grow your tree of falsehood from a small grain of truth. Do not follow those who lie in contempt of reality. Let your lie be even more logical than the truth itself, so the weary travelers may find repose.
author: Czeslaw Milosz

quote: In truth, the only restrictions on our capacity to astonish ourselves and each other are imposed by our own minds.
author: David Blaine

quote: We must never throw away a bushel of truth because it happens to contain a few grains of chaff.
author: Dean Stanley

quote: I would rather the man who presents something for my consideration subject me to a zephyr of truth and a gentle breeze of responsibility rather than blow me down with a curtain of hot wind.
author: Grover Cleveland

quote: But that citizen's perception was also at one with the truth in recognizing that the very brutality of the means by which the IRA were pursuing change was destructive of the trust upon which new possibilities would have to be based.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: In fact, in lyric poetry, truthfulness becomes recognizable as a ring of truth within the medium itself.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: The modern composer builds upon the foundation of truth.
author: Claudio Monteverdi

quote: To begin with myself, then, the utterances of men concerning me will differ widely, since in passing judgment almost every one is influenced not so much by truth as by preference, and good and evil report alike know no bounds.
author: Petrarch

quote: There is in the end no remedy but truth. It is the one course that cannot be evil.
author: Ellis Peters

quote: It took a deadly illness to put me eye to eye with that truth, but it is a truth that the country, caught up in its ruthless ambitions and moral decay, can learn on my dime.
author: Lee Atwater

quote: The truth of the matter was that I made myself disappear. I never liked being a Judge, so I just decided to start over. Sorry to inconvenience anyone.
author: Joseph Force Crater

quote: Until we have a better relationship between private performance and the public truth, as was demonstrated with Watergate, we as the public are absolutely right to remain suspicious, contemptuous even, of the secrecy and the misinformation which is the digest of our news.
author: John le Carre

quote: What I'm dealing with is so vast and great that it can't be called the truth. It's above the truth.
author: Sun Ra

quote: If you tell the truth about how you're feeling, it becomes funny.
author: Larry David

quote: It would be difficult to discover the truth about the universe if we refused to consider anything that might be true.
author: Richard Morris

quote: I want a language that speaks the truth.
author: Studs Terkel

quote: When a truth is necessary, the reason for it can be found by analysis, that is, by resolving it into simpler ideas and truths until the primary ones are reached.
author: Gottfried Leibniz

quote: When a man fails to see the truth of certain generally accepted views, there is no law compelling him to provoke animosity by announcing his dissent.
author: George Henry Lewes

quote: The truth is that from birth on we are, to one extent or another, a fairly sensual species.
author: Jock Sturges

quote: Unemployment is sky-rocketing; deflation is in our future for the first time since the Great Depression. I don't care whose fault it is, it's the truth.
author: John Mellencamp

quote: This Divine truth flows into heaven from the Lord from His Divine love.
author: Emanuel Swedenborg

quote: I was a very good baseball and football player, but my father always told me I was much more interested in how I looked playing baseball or football than in actually playing. There's great truth in that.
author: John Malkovich

quote: On the stage, you have to find truth, even if you have to lose the audience.
author: Anthony Quinn

quote: I am afraid the Spanish American has not always a very strict regard for truth.
author: Edward Burnett Tylor

quote: I always try to improve, to find new ways of expressing myself, to keep looking for truth and originality.
author: Burt Lancaster

quote: My assignment is what every writer's assignment is: tell the truth of his own time.
author: Leslie Fiedler

quote: I think that the truth is a really stern taskmistress.
author: Carrie Fisher

quote: A gift of truth is the gift of love.
author: David Icke

quote: I believe certain members of the U.S. Congress have aided in the oppression and diversion of critical information that could have revealed a fullness of truth long ago.
author: Bo Gritz

quote: A remark generally hurts in proportion to its truth.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The truth may be out there, but lies are inside your head.
author: Terry Pratchett

quote: Man approaches the unattainable truth through a succession of errors.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Beyond a doubt truth bears the same relation to falsehood as light to darkness.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Books and all forms of writing are terror to those who wish to suppress the truth.
author: Wole Soyinka

quote: I speak the truth not so much as I would, but as much as I dare, and I dare a little more as I grow older.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: The greatest friend of truth is Time, her greatest enemy is Prejudice, and her constant companion is Humility.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: Poetry a criticism of life under the conditions fixed for such a criticism by the laws of poetic truth and poetic beauty.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: People do think that if they avoid the truth, it might change to something better before they have to hear it.
author: Marsha Norman

quote: Truth is not exciting enough to those who depend on the characters and lives of their neighbors for all their amusement.
author: George Bancroft

quote: The world is... the natural setting of, and field for, all my thoughts and all my explicit perceptions. Truth does not inhabit only the inner man, or more accurately, there is no inner man, man is in the world, and only in the world does he know himself.
author: Maurice Merleau-Ponty

quote: In morals, truth is but little prized when it is a mere sentiment, and only attains its full value when realized in the world as fact.
author: Ernest Renan

quote: Some minds remain open long enough for the truth not only to enter but to pass on through by way of a ready exit without pausing anywhere along the route.
author: Elizabeth Kenny

quote: I put forward formless and unresolved notions, as do those who publish doubtful questions to debate in the schools, not to establish the truth but to seek it.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Truth is the silliest thing under the sun. Try to get a living by the Truth and go to the Soup Societies. Heavens! Let any clergyman try to preach the Truth from its very stronghold, the pulpit, and they would ride him out of his church on his own pulpit bannister.
author: Herman Melville

quote: The tendency of modern scientific teaching is to neglect the great books, to lay far too much stress upon relatively unimportant modern work, and to present masses of detail of doubtful truth and questionable weight in such a way as to obscure principles.
author: Ronald Fisher

quote: Justice and truth are too such subtle points that our tools are too blunt to touch them accurately.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Friendless. Having no favors to bestow. Destitute of fortune. Addicted to utterance of truth and common sense.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Truth titillates the imagination far less than fiction.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: A gaffe is when a politician tells the truth.
author: Michael Kinsley

quote: I am very fond of truth, but not at all of martyrdom.
author: Voltaire

quote: A taste for truth at any cost is a passion which spares nothing.
author: Albert Camus

quote: A good novel tells us the truth about its hero but a bad novel tells us the truth about its author.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Half a truth is better than no politics.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: In matters of truth the fact that you don't want to publish something is, nine times out of ten, a proof that you ought to publish it.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: The Bible may be the truth, but it is not the whole truth and nothing but the truth.
author: Samuel Butler

quote: An unexciting truth may be eclipsed by a thrilling lie.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: An honest man speaks the truth, though it may give offence; a vain man, in order that it may.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Truth is what works.
author: William James

quote: Live truth instead of professing it.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Richard Nixon is a no good, lying bastard. He can lie out of both sides of his mouth at the same time, and if he ever caught himself telling the truth, he'd lie just to keep his hand in.
author: Harry S Truman

quote: The words of truth are simple.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Truth is often the favorite tool of those who deceive.
author: Bryant H. McGill

quote: The essence of humanity's spiritual dilemma is that we evolved genetically to accept one truth and discovered another. Is there a way to erase the dilemma, to resolve the contradictions between the transcendentalist and the empiricist world views?
author: E. O. Wilson

quote: Veiling truth in mystery.
author: Virgil

quote: Whatever has happened in my quest for innovation has been part of my quest for immaculate reality.
author: George Lucas

quote: The logic of the world is prior to all truth and falsehood.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: Light is the symbol of truth.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Truth forever on the scaffold, wrong forever on the throne.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Humility is truth.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: For truth has such a face and such a mien, as to be loved needs only to be seen.
author: John Dryden

quote: Only in men's imagination does every truth find an effective and undeniable existence. Imagination, not invention, is the supreme master of art as of life.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Truth of a modest sort I can promise you, and also sincerity. That complete, praiseworthy sincerity which, while it delivers one into the hands of one's enemies, is as likely as not to embroil one with one's friends.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Truth always originates in a minority of one, and every custom begins as a broken precedent.
author: Will Durant

quote: Truth is not a matter of personal viewpoint.
author: Vernon Howard

quote: If the individual, or heretic, gets hold of some essential truth, or sees some error in the system being practiced, he commits so many marginal errors himself that he is worn out before he can establish his point.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: Not that I regret saying what I believed to be the truth, but I regret anything that I might have written or spoken that could have been used in a way to help to foster that atmosphere out of which came the loss of life of Brother Malcolm.
author: Louis Farrakhan

quote: Truth makes on the ocean of nature no one track of light; every eye, looking on, finds its own.
author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

quote: Infinite love is the only truth. Everything else is illusion.
author: David Icke

quote: The pursuit of truth will set you free even if you never catch up with it.
author: Clarence Darrow

quote: While we are examining into everything we sometimes find truth where we least expected it.
author: Quintilian

quote: What is truth? Truth doesn't really exist. Who is going to judge whether my experience of an incident is more valid than yours? No one can be trusted to be the judge of that.
author: Tracey Emin

quote: No one ever tells us the truth, even those we love.
author: Anna Held

quote: Nobody speaks the truth when there is something they must have.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: I will tell the truth wherever I please.
author: Mary Harris Jones

quote: I left in love, in laughter, and in truth, and wherever truth, love and laughter abide, I am there in spirit.
author: Bill Hicks

quote: There are certain persons for whom pure Truth is a poison.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: Unless one always speaks the truth, one cannot find God Who is the soul of truth.
author: Ramakrishna

quote: For scholarship - if it is to be scholarship - requires, in addition to liberty, that the truth take precedence over all sectarian interests, including self-interest.
author: John Charles Polanyi

quote: Truth sits upon the lips of dying men.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: The first reaction to truth is hatred.
author: Tertullian

quote: The honest truth is that if this government were to propose the massacre of the first-born, it would still have no difficulty in getting it through the Commons.
author: Diane Abbott

quote: No one should ever say that it was my ignorance if I did or showed forth anything however small according to God's good pleasure; but let this be your conclusion and let it so be thought, that - as is the perfect truth - it was the gift of God.
author: Saint Patrick

quote: The truth is overrated.
author: Paul Westerberg

quote: I preach there are all kinds of truth, your truth and somebody else's. But behind all of them there is only one truth and that is that there's no truth.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: Justice is rather the activity of truth, than a virtue in itself. Truth tells us what is due to others, and justice renders that due. Injustice is acting a lie.
author: Horace Walpole

quote: My longing for truth was a single prayer.
author: Edith Stein

quote: Truth comes out in wine.
author: Pliny the Elder

quote: Truth disappears with the telling of it.
author: Lawrence Durrell

quote: Falsehood is cowardice, the truth courage.
author: Hosea Ballou

quote: Claiming that you have got the truth wrapped up does breed violence and intolerance.
author: Timothy Radcliffe

quote: Truth is stranger than fiction fiction has to make sense.
author: Leo Rosten

quote: If we were to abandon concern for what is true, what is false, and what remains indeterminate, the world would be totally chaotic. Even those who deny the importance of truth, on the one hand, are quick to jump on anyone who is caught lying.
author: Howard Gardner

quote: To tell you the truth, in my work, love is always in opposition to the elements. It creates dilemmas. It brings in suffering. We can't live with it, and we can't live without it. You'll rarely find a happy ending in my work.
author: Krzysztof Kieslowski

quote: I think I'm telling the truth. I sat by Ray Perkins at the Hall of Fame dinner in New York, and at that time he didn't know he was our coach and I didn't either.
author: Bear Bryant

quote: Not so the scientist. The very essence of his life is the service of truth.
author: Franz Boas

quote: Human love has little regard for the truth. It makes the truth relative, since nothing, not even the truth, must come between it and the beloved person.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quote: In the last few years, the very idea of telling the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth is dredged up only as a final resort when the alternative options of deception, threat and bribery have all been exhausted.
author: Michael Musto

quote: Everybody in America is soft, and hates conflict. The cure for this, both in politics and social life, is the same - hardihood. Give them raw truth.
author: John Jay Chapman

quote: Slogans which deafened us so that we could not hear the truth.
author: Ernst Toller

quote: Because you're not what I would have you be, I blind myself to who, in truth, you are.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: Now the truth of the matter is that there are a lot of things people don't understand. Take the Einstein theory. Take taxes. Take love. Do you understand them? Neither do I. But they exist. They happen.
author: Dalton Trumbo

quote: In this play we're dealing with relative truths - who's lying, who's telling the truth. But underneath that, Ed and I have hit this deeper level of intimacy between old friends that comes out in the play.
author: Fred Ward

quote: And the sad truth is that nobody wants me to write comedy. The Exorcist not only ended that career, it expunged all memory of its existence.
author: William Peter Blatty

quote: Mind and spirit together make up that which separates us from the rest of the animal world, that which enables a man to know the truth and that which enables him to die for the truth.
author: Edith Hamilton

quote: The Spirit is Love expressed towards man as redeeming love, and the Spirit is truth, and the Spirit is the Holy Spirit. Redemption is inconceivable without truth and holiness.
author: Roland Allen

quote: The idealists dream and the dream is told, and the practical men listen and ponder and bring back the truth and apply it to human life, and progress and growth and higher human ideals come into being and so the world moves ever on.
author: Anna Howard Shaw

quote: Accuracy of language is one of the bulwarks of truth.
author: Anna Jameson

quote: Never ever doubt in magic. The purest honest thoughts come from children, ask any child if they believe in magic and they will tell you the truth.
author: Scott Dixon

quote: The intuition of free will gives us the truth.
author: Corliss Lamont

quote: The absolute truth is the thing that makes people laugh.
author: Carl Reiner

quote: The antiquity and general acceptance of an opinion is not assurance of its truth.
author: Pierre Bayle

quote: Any necessary truth, whether a priori or a posteriori, could not have turned out otherwise.
author: Saul Kripke

quote: Every emancipation has in it the seeds of a new slavery, and every truth easily becomes a lie.
author: I. F. Stone

quote: The truth cannot be asserted without denouncing the falsehood.
author: Leslie Stephen

quote: I am a fighter. I believe in that which is right, and the truth is, I have been the Lone Ranger for the past thirty years and I will not give up the fight. I love my public and I'll fight for you. I'll continue to make personal appearances for my thousands of fans.
author: Clayton Moore

quote: The ultimate aim of the human mind, in all its efforts, is to become acquainted with Truth.
author: Eliza Farnham

quote: Literature boils with the madcap careers of writers brought to the edge by the demands of living on their nerves, wringing out their memories and their nightmares to extract meaning, truth, beauty.
author: Herbert Gold

quote: I was not out to paint beautiful pictures even painting good pictures was not important to me. I wanted only to help the truth burst forth.
author: Alice Duer Miller

quote: He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life.
author: Muhammad Ali

quote: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
author: Bruce Lee

quote: We don't develop courage by being happy every day. We develop it by surviving difficult times and challenging adversity.
author: Barbara De Angelis

quote: If you have no confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life.
author: Marcus Garvey

quote: Courage, sacrifice, determination, commitment, toughness, heart, talent, guts. That's what little girls are made of.
author: Bethany Hamilton

quote: Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Efforts and courage are not enough without purpose and direction.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: Courage is fire, and bullying is smoke.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Wisdom, compassion, and courage are the three universally recognized moral qualities of men.
author: Confucius

quote: Jump, and you will find out how to unfold your wings as you fall.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: One isn't necessarily born with courage, but one is born with potential. Without courage, we cannot practice any other virtue with consistency. We can't be kind, true, merciful, generous, or honest.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: The opposite for courage is not cowardice, it is conformity. Even a dead fish can go with the flow.
author: Jim Hightower

quote: I think we all have empathy. We may not have enough courage to display it.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: From caring comes courage.
author: Lao Tzu

quote: If human beings had genuine courage, they'd wear their costumes every day of the year, not just on Halloween.
author: Douglas Coupland

quote: Courage is not simply one of the virtues, but the form of every virtue at the testing point.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Courage is grace under pressure.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Courage, above all things, is the first quality of a warrior.
author: Carl von Clausewitz

quote: You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
author: Aristotle

quote: Don't Make Assumptions. Find the courage to ask questions and to express what you really want. Communicate with others as clearly as you can to avoid misunderstandings, sadness and drama. With just this one agreement, you can completely transform your life.
author: Don Miguel Ruiz

quote: He is a man of courage who does not run away, but remains at his post and fights against the enemy.
author: Socrates

quote: Creativity takes courage.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: As a former NFL player, I am one American who will have nothing to do with any NFL Team that cannot find the corporate courage to stand for the millions of courageous past great Americans whose sacrifice gave meaning to our flag and national anthem and to the millions upon millions who still dream to come to its free shores.
author: Burgess Owens

quote: On great teams - the kind where people trust each other, engage in open conflict, and then commit to decisions - team members have the courage and confidence to confront one another when they see something that isn't serving the team.
author: Patrick Lencioni

quote: Success is not measured by what you accomplish, but by the opposition you have encountered, and the courage with which you have maintained the struggle against overwhelming odds.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: The principles of living greatly include the capacity to face trouble with courage, disappointment with cheerfulness, and trial with humility.
author: Thomas S. Monson

quote: I know what it is to feel unloved, to want revenge, to make mistakes, to suffer disappointment, yet also to find the courage to go forward in life.
author: Tim O'Brien

quote: Courtesy is as much a mark of a gentleman as courage.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Let us not pray to be sheltered from dangers but to be fearless when facing them.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Competing at the highest level is not about winning. It's about preparation, courage, understanding and nurturing your people, and heart. Winning is the result.
author: Joe Torre

quote: I believe that my worth is not measured by what I do, by the honors that are bestowed upon me, or by material wealth that I might obtain. Instead, I am measured by the courage I show while standing for my beliefs, by the dedication I exhibit to ensure my word is good, and the resolve I undertake to establish my actions and deeds as honorable.
author: Burgess Owens

quote: People say to me all the time, 'You have no fear.' I tell them, 'No, that's not true. I'm scared all the time. You have to have fear in order to have courage. I'm a courageous person because I'm a scared person.'
author: Ronda Rousey

quote: The greatest obstacle to being heroic is the doubt whether one may not be going to prove one's self a fool; the truest heroism is to resist the doubt; and the profoundest wisdom, to know when it ought to be resisted, and when it be obeyed.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: There are no easy answers, but there are simple answers. We must have the courage to do what we know is morally right.
author: Ronald Reagan

quote: One man with courage is a majority.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Soldiers, when committed to a task, can't compromise. It's unrelenting devotion to the standards of duty and courage, absolute loyalty to others, not letting the task go until it's been done.
author: John Keegan

quote: With courage and character, American soldiers continue to put themselves on the line to defend our freedom, and so many have paid the ultimate sacrifice.
author: Dan Lipinski

quote: It is my deepest belief that only by giving our lives do we find life. I am convinced that the truest act of courage, the strongest act of manliness is to sacrifice ourselves for others in a totally non-violent struggle for justice.
author: Cesar Chavez

quote: Muhammad Ali struck us in the middle of America's darkest night, in the heart of its most threatening gathering storm. His power toppled the mightiest of foes, and his intense light shined on America, and we were able to see clearly injustice, inequality, poverty, pride, self realization, courage, laughter, love, joy and religious freedom for all.
author: Billy Crystal

quote: Valor is stability, not of legs and arms, but of courage and the soul.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: How few there are who have courage enough to own their faults, or resolution enough to mend them.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Character contributes to beauty. It fortifies a woman as her youth fades. A mode of conduct, a standard of courage, discipline, fortitude, and integrity can do a great deal to make a woman beautiful.
author: Jacqueline Bisset

quote: In the Soviet army it takes more courage to retreat than advance.
author: Joseph Stalin

quote: We've begun to raise daughters more like sons... but few have the courage to raise our sons more like our daughters.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: Faced with what is right, to leave it undone shows a lack of courage.
author: Confucius

quote: I think we judge talent wrong. What do we see as talent? I think I have made the same mistake myself. We judge talent by people's ability to strike a cricket ball. The sweetness, the timing. That's the only thing we see as talent. Things like determination, courage, discipline, temperament, these are also talent.
author: Rahul Dravid

quote: It is courage, courage, courage, that raises the blood of life to crimson splendor. Live bravely and present a brave front to adversity.
author: Horace

quote: A man of courage never needs weapons, but he may need bail.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: Make-up is the last thing to enhance your beauty, but it's very important because it builds up your self-confidence and gives you more courage.
author: Evelyn Lauder

quote: He who is brave is free.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: The opposite of courage in our society is not cowardice, it is conformity.
author: Rollo May

quote: You have setbacks in your life, and adversity. You can be discouraged about it or have courage to get through it and be better.
author: Austin Seferian-Jenkins

quote: Happy are those who dare courageously to defend what they love.
author: Ovid

quote: Optimism is essential to achievement and it is also the foundation of courage and true progress.
author: Nicholas M. Butler

quote: You have to develop ways so that you can take up for yourself, and then you take up for someone else. And so sooner or later, you have enough courage to really stand up for the human race and say, 'I'm a representative.'
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Australia is a nation of compassion. Courage and compassion. And the third of these great values: resilience.
author: Kevin Rudd

quote: To create one's world in any of the arts takes courage.
author: Georgia O'Keeffe

quote: The strangest, most generous, and proudest of all virtues is true courage.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Real nobility is based on scorn, courage, and profound indifference.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The first virtue in a soldier is endurance of fatigue courage is only the second virtue.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Either you decide to stay in the shallow end of the pool or you go out in the ocean.
author: Christopher Reeve

quote: He who has courage and faith will never perish in misery!
author: Anne Frank

quote: Presumption should never make us neglect that which appears easy to us, nor despair make us lose courage at the sight of difficulties.
author: Benjamin Banneker

quote: True courage is like a kite a contrary wind raises it higher.
author: John Petit-Senn

quote: Untutored courage is useless in the face of educated bullets.
author: George S. Patton

quote: Any intelligent fool can make things bigger and more complex... It takes a touch of genius - and a lot of courage to move in the opposite direction.
author: E. F. Schumacher

quote: Bravery is being the only one who knows you're afraid.
author: Franklin P. Jones

quote: We all live in the same house, we all must be part of the effort to hold down our little house. When you see something that is not right, not fair, not just... do something about it. Say something. Have the courage. Have the backbone. Get in the way. Walk with the wind. It's all going to work out.
author: John Lewis

quote: People with courage and character always seem sinister to the rest.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: Courage is a kind of salvation.
author: Plato

quote: Physical bravery is an animal instinct moral bravery is much higher and truer courage.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: The courage of life is often a less dramatic spectacle than the courage of a final moment but it is no less a magnificent mixture of triumph and tragedy.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: The test of courage comes when we are in the minority. The test of tolerance comes when we are in the majority.
author: Ralph W. Sockman

quote: Killing yourself is a major commitment, it takes a kind of courage. Most people just lead lives of cowardly desperation. It's kinda half suicide where you just dull yourself with substances.
author: Robert Crumb

quote: The British were indeed very far superior to the Americans in every respect necessary to military operations, except the revivified courage and resolution, the result of sudden success after despair.
author: Mercy Otis Warren

quote: If you could get up the courage to begin, you have the courage to succeed.
author: David Viscott

quote: Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections.
author: Saint Francis de Sales

quote: There has to be this pioneer, the individual who has the courage, the ambition to overcome the obstacles that always develop when one tries to do something worthwhile, especially when it is new and different.
author: Alfred P. Sloan

quote: The difficult thing is that vulnerability is the first thing I look for in you and the last thing I'm willing to show you. In you, it's courage and daring. In me, it's weakness.
author: Brene Brown

quote: Anyone can support a team that is winning - it takes no courage. But to stand behind a team to defend a team when it is down and really needs you, that takes a lot of courage.
author: Bart Starr

quote: Courage - a perfect sensibility of the measure of danger, and a mental willingness to endure it.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: Morality may consist solely in the courage of making a choice.
author: Leon Blum

quote: Love and peace of mind do protect us. They allow us to overcome the problems that life hands us. They teach us to survive... to live now... to have the courage to confront each day.
author: Bernie Siegel

quote: If you want to lose 40 pounds, you order salad instead of fries. If you want to be a better friend, you take the phone call instead of screening it. If you want to write a novel, you sit down and write a single paragraph. It's scary to make major changes, but we usually have enough courage to take the next right step.
author: Regina Brett

quote: True courage is not the brutal force of vulgar heroes, but the firm resolve of virtue and reason.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Earth teach me to forget myself as melted snow forgets its life. Earth teach me resignation as the leaves which die in the fall. Earth teach me courage as the tree which stands all alone. Earth teach me regeneration as the seed which rises in the spring.
author: William Alexander

quote: Courage means to keep working a relationship, to continue seeking solutions to difficult problems, and to stay focused during stressful periods.
author: Denis Waitley

quote: You can't forgive without loving. And I don't mean sentimentality. I don't mean mush. I mean having enough courage to stand up and say, 'I forgive. I'm finished with it.'
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Courage is rightly esteemed the first of human qualities... because it is the quality which guarantees all others.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Moral courage is higher and a rarer virtue than physical courage.
author: William Slim

quote: Have the courage to face a difficulty lest it kick you harder than you bargain for.
author: Stanislaus I

quote: The weak in courage is strong in cunning.
author: William Blake

quote: To show that a comedian on stage in India talking about sanitation or in South Africa talking about HIV and AIDS awareness, if you follow the joke into their lives, you can see that, like, oh, these things aren't just contrived in joke books. This is real life. I think the best comedians have that bravery and courage to say, Oh, this is what it is.
author: Hasan Minhaj

quote: The principal act of courage is to endure and withstand dangers doggedly rather than to attack them.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: True courage is being afraid, and going ahead and doing your job anyhow, that's what courage is.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quote: Courage in danger is half the battle.
author: Plautus

quote: We've let the blade of our innocence dull over time, and it's only in innocence that you find any kind of magic, any kind of courage.
author: Sean Penn

quote: I'm sick of not having the courage to be an absolute nobody.
author: J. D. Salinger

quote: Courage is never to let your actions be influenced by your fears.
author: Arthur Koestler

quote: The courage to be is the courage to accept oneself, in spite of being unacceptable.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: Never be discouraged. If I were sunk in the lowest pits of Nova Scotia, with the Rocky Mountains piled on me, I would hang on, exercise faith, and keep up good courage, and I would come out on top.
author: Joseph Smith, Jr.

quote: You must study to be frank with the world: Frankness is the child of honesty and courage.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: Part of courage is simple consistency.
author: Peggy Noonan

quote: When you put on clothes that are fighting against something, you can feel your courage grow. Clothing can set you free.
author: Rei Kawakubo

quote: Each person has inside a basic decency and goodness. If he listens to it and acts on it, he is giving a great deal of what it is the world needs most. It is not complicated but it takes courage. It takes courage for a person to listen to his own goodness and act on it.
author: Pablo Casals

quote: Courage is willingness to take the risk once you know the odds. Optimistic overconfidence means you are taking the risk because you don't know the odds. It's a big difference.
author: Daniel Kahneman

quote: A nation which has forgotten the quality of courage which in the past has been brought to public life is not as likely to insist upon or regard that quality in its chosen leaders today - and in fact we have forgotten.
author: John F. Kennedy

quote: Optimism is the foundation of courage.
author: Nicholas M. Butler

quote: Today we affirm a new commitment to live out our nation's promise through civility, courage, compassion and character.
author: George W. Bush

quote: Unless a reviewer has the courage to give you unqualified praise, I say ignore the bastard.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: Peace is a fragile thing. It takes courage to secure it. It takes wisdom to maintain it.
author: Jenny Shipley

quote: The man who has the courage of his platitudes is always a successful man.
author: Van Wyck Brooks

quote: Courage and willingness to just go for it, whether it is a conversation or a spontaneous trip or trying new things that are scary - it is a really attractive quality.
author: Alanis Morissette

quote: Buddhist practices offer a way of saying, 'Hey, come back over here, reconnect.' The only way that you'll actually wake up and have some freedom is if you have the capacity and courage to stay with the vulnerability and the discomfort.
author: Tara Brach

quote: I can tell you character traits I admire and work to develop in myself - perseverance, self-discipline, courage to stand up for what is right even when it is against one's friends or one's self.
author: Dalia Mogahed

quote: The only thing is, people have to develop courage. It is most important of all the virtues. Because without courage, you can't practice any other virtues consistently.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: My mother always taught us that if people don't agree with you, the important thing is to listen to them. But if you've listened to them carefully and you still think that you're right, then you must have the courage of your convictions.
author: Jane Goodall

quote: Most people talk; we do things. They plan; we achieve. They hesitate; we move ahead. We are living proof that when human beings have the courage and commitment to transform a dream into reality, there is nothing that can stop them.
author: Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum

quote: I would like to tell the young men and women before me not to lose hope and courage. Success can only come to you by courageous devotion to the task lying in front of you.
author: C. V. Raman

quote: There are pretenders to piety as well as to courage.
author: Moliere

quote: Guilt is just as powerful, but its influence is positive, while shame's is destructive. Shame erodes our courage and fuels disengagement.
author: Brene Brown

quote: For thousands of years, human beings have been obsessed with beauty, truth, love, honor, altruism, courage, social relationships, art, and God. They all go together as subjective experiences, and it's a straw man to set God up as the delusion. If he is, then so is truth itself or beauty itself.
author: Deepak Chopra

quote: I've always been independent. I've always had courage. But I didn't always own my diabetes.
author: Mary Tyler Moore

quote: Fearlessness is not only possible, it is the ultimate joy. When you touch nonfear, you are free.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

quote: To see what is right and not to do it is want of courage, or of principle.
author: Confucius

quote: Honest conviction is my courage the Constitution is my guide.
author: Andrew Johnson

quote: We learned to be patient observers like the owl. We learned cleverness from the crow, and courage from the jay, who will attack an owl ten times its size to drive it off its territory. But above all of them ranked the chickadee because of its indomitable spirit.
author: Tom Brown, Jr.

quote: My sword I give to him that shall succeed me in my pilgrimage, and my courage and skill to him that can get it.
author: John Bunyan

quote: If the Christian is a restorationist, a legalist, if he wants everything clear and safe, then he will find nothing. Tradition and memory of the past must help us to have the courage to open up new areas to God.
author: Pope Francis

quote: Only choices made in love are compassionate. There are no exceptions. Do you have the courage to act with an empowered heart without attachment to the outcome? If not, you have no ability to give or experience compassion. That is the shocking truth.
author: Gary Zukav

quote: Life is to be entered upon with courage.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: Courage is being afraid but going on anyhow.
author: Dan Rather

quote: I know of no higher fortitude than stubborness in the face of overwhelming odds.
author: Louis Nizer

quote: It requires more courage to suffer than to die.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: I have a lot of things to prove to myself. One is that I can live my life fearlessly.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: A great deal of talent is lost to the world for want of a little courage. Every day sends to their graves obscure men whose timidity prevented them from making a first effort.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: To have courage for whatever comes in life - everything lies in that.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quote: Courage is on display every day, and only the courageous wring the most out of life.
author: Zig Ziglar

quote: The trials on the road to world harmony are no greater than the courage of those who accept the challenge.
author: Carl Lewis

quote: I tend to think you're fearless when you recognize why you should be scared of things, but do them anyway.
author: Christian Bale

quote: Courage is poorly housed that dwells in numbers; the lion never counts the herd that are about him, nor weighs how many flocks he has to scatter.
author: Aaron Hill

quote: Curiosity, rationalization, and laziness are no match against courage, self-control, and mental toughness.
author: John Bytheway

quote: That's what acting is - it's about... having the courage to allow your audience into the private moments of your characters' lives.
author: Kerry Washington

quote: Courage - you develop courage by doing small things like just as if you wouldn't want to pick up a 100-pound weight without preparing yourself.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Courage and grace are a formidable mixture. The only place to see it is in the bullring.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: I was a little doubtful about the propriety of going to the Mammoth Cave without a gentleman escort, but if two ladies travel alone they must have the courage of men.
author: Maria Mitchell

quote: Being tall has a major impact in general. It takes some courage to be as big as you are - to live up to it and not be intimidated by the graceful tiny people.
author: Sigourney Weaver

quote: In the military, you learn the essence of people. You see so many examples of self-sacrifice and moral courage. In the rest of life, you don't get that many opportunities to be sure of your friends.
author: Adam Driver

quote: Unjust. How many times I've used that word, scolded myself with it. All I mean by it now is that I don't have the final courage to say that I refuse to preside over violations against myself, and to hell with justice.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: Decision is a risk rooted in the courage of being free.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: Ingenuity, plus courage, plus work, equals miracles.
author: Bob Richards

quote: I have a hat. It is graceful and feminine and give me a certain dignity, as if I were attending a state funeral or something. Someday I may get up enough courage to wear it, instead of carrying it.
author: Erma Bombeck

quote: In strife who inquires whether stratagem or courage was used?
author: Virgil

quote: This soul, or life within us, by no means agrees with the life outside us. If one has the courage to ask her what she thinks, she is always saying the very opposite to what other people say.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: A man of courage is also full of faith.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Physical courage, which despises all danger, will make a man brave in one way; and moral courage, which despises all opinion, will make a man brave in another.
author: Charles Caleb Colton

quote: To him that waits all things reveal themselves, provided that he has the courage not to deny, in the darkness, what he has seen in the light.
author: Coventry Patmore

quote: Real courage is knowing what faces you and knowing how to face it.
author: Timothy Dalton

quote: I beg you take courage the brave soul can mend even disaster.
author: Catherine the Great

quote: It takes vision and courage to create - it takes faith and courage to prove.
author: Owen D. Young

quote: Courage! I have shown it for years think you I shall lose it at the moment when my sufferings are to end?
author: Marie Antoinette

quote: You take a number of small steps which you believe are right, thinking maybe tomorrow somebody will treat this as a dangerous provocation. And then you wait. If there is no reaction, you take another step: courage is only an accumulation of small steps.
author: George Konrad

quote: There's only one requirement of any of us, and that is to be courageous. Because courage, as you might know, defines all other human behavior. And, I believe - because I've done a little of this myself - pretending to be courageous is just as good as the real thing.
author: David Letterman

quote: Acting is really about having the courage to fail in front of people.
author: Adam Driver

quote: I think we spend so much of our lives trying to pretend that we know what's going to happen next. In fact we don't. To recognize that we don't know even what will happen this afternoon and yet having the courage to move forward - that's one meaning of faith.
author: Sharon Salzberg

quote: Next to courage, willpower is the most important thing in politics.
author: Paul Johnson

quote: The best marriages are the ones where we can go out in the world and really put ourselves out there. A lot of times we'll fail, and sometimes we'll pull it off. But good marriages are when you can go home and know that your vulnerability will be honored as courage, and that you'll find support.
author: Brene Brown

quote: It shouldn't take extreme courage and a willingness to go to prison for decades or even life to blow the whistle on bad government acts done in secret. But it does. And that is an immense problem for democracy, one that all journalists should be united in fighting.
author: Glenn Greenwald

quote: What I am very, very moved and struck by is that so many people in the world are often living a life that they hadn't planned for themselves. And they wake up one day and say, 'Hang on. Who am I? Is this really me? Is this what I really wanted?' And also, 'Can I change it? Have I got the courage to change it?'
author: Kate Winslet

quote: The most memorable interviews for me are folks whose names I don't know: young civil rights leaders in the South, showing great courage as they walked into a town in the dark of night. A doctor working for 'Doctors Without Borders' in Somalia, operating by kerosene light in a tent. Those are the kinds of people that linger in your memory.
author: Tom Brokaw

quote: Navigating a nonsober world of restaurants and bars, dinner parties, and benefits is like anything that requires practice. Like tennis or a foreign language, it gets easier the more you do it. But like all beginnings, it can be awkward. You stumble, you worry, and then there are unexpected moments of grace that give you the courage to keep going.
author: Bill Clegg

quote: Had we lived I should have had a tale to tell of the hardihood, endurance and courage of my companions which would have stirred the heart of every Englishman. These rough notes and our dead bodies must tell the tale.
author: Robert Falcon Scott

quote: The gospel alone liberates you to live a life of scandalous generosity, unrestrained sacrifice, uncommon valor, and unbounded courage.
author: Tullian Tchividjian

quote: There can be no great courage where there is no confidence or assurance, and half the battle is in the conviction that we can do what we undertake.
author: Orison Swett Marden

quote: In acting, there's a type of courage you're recognized for all the time. You lose 100 pounds and play a guy with AIDS, and you get rewarded. But, in life, doing what is courageous is quiet, and no one knows about it. Courage is someone making sacrifices for their family or making selfless decisions for what they hope or feel.
author: Rob Lowe

quote: Art, it seems to me, doesn't need freedom so much as it needs courage and love - some would call it 'soul' or 'Eros.'
author: Michael Leunig

quote: Loving the church also means having the courage to make difficult, trying choices, having ever before oneself the good of the church and not one's own.
author: Pope Benedict XVI

quote: America needs jobs, smaller government, less spending and a president with the courage to offer more than yet another speech.
author: Rick Perry

quote: Change will never happen when people lack the ability and courage to see themselves for who they are.
author: Bryant H. McGill

quote: Leaders are focused on using their vision and courage to do great things. This means challenging the way things are done and then sharing the journey with others.
author: Lewis Howes

quote: Work on something that matters. Have courage.
author: Ginni Rometty

quote: For a long time, it was like I was part of some special forces unit: I'd land, meet everyone, five minutes later I'd have to do some amazing work, then - boom! - I'm out again. You know, playing supporting parts takes courage.
author: John C. Reilly

quote: We read our children stories starring elephants and monkeys and bears to teach them about nobility, curiosity and courage, to warn them against selfishness and stubbornness.
author: Lydia Millet

quote: I have no physical courage, I've asked for a double.
author: Catherine Deneuve

quote: I have the responsibility of over four million people, and I am in a position to do good, to be able to bring about a new life for my people, and I will continue to move in that direction. It's a burden, but it needs to be done, and you have to have the courage and wisdom to see it through.
author: Abdullah II of Jordan

quote: I have had a lot of crushes but have never had the courage to go up to a girl and say what I feel. I am scared of rejection.
author: Tiger Shroff

quote: The last thing a woman will consent to discover in a man whom she loves, or on whom she simply depends, is want of courage.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: John Glenn's life will long be remembered for his time in space, his courage, and his service to all Americans.
author: Katherine Johnson

quote: With his trademark courage and conviction, President Reagan led us out of the Cold War, spreading his vision of freedom, resulting in the release of millions of people from the yoke of communism.
author: John Doolittle

quote: We can never intimidate and discourage the people who voice their words with courage. The essence of freedom rests precisely here - in the freedom of expression of the people. And we must protect it.
author: Tsakhiagiin Elbegdorj

quote: Wisdom, prudence, forethought, these are essential. But not second to these that noble courage which adventures the right, and leaves the consequences to God.
author: Robert Dale Owen

quote: These rules may seem simple enough, but it will require great morale and physical courage to adhere to them. But if carried out in the strict sense of the word it will surely lead to a greater success than could otherwise be attained.
author: Major Taylor

quote: If the City Council wants to hold the police accountable, it has the subpoena power and oversight responsibility to do so. They don't have the courage to do it.
author: Sal Albanese

quote: The courage to be is rooted in the God who appears when God has disappeared in the anxiety of doubt.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: I try to be a truthful artist and I try to show a level of courage. I enjoy that. I'm a messenger.
author: Jeff Koons

quote: Courage is often lack of insight, whereas cowardice in many cases is based on good information.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: Being a leader for me is about having the courage to speak the truth, and live the truth, despite attempts to silence our thoughts, feelings, and past experiences.
author: Zainab Salbi

quote: The one man other than my father who made the most lasting impression was an uncle, Serge B. Benson. He taught me in three different classes - but above all, he taught me lessons in moral, physical, and intellectual courage that I have tried to apply in later life.
author: Ezra Taft Benson

quote: Let's drink to the spirit of gallantry and courage that made a strange Heaven out of unbelievable Hell, and let's drink to the hope that one day this country of ours, which we love so much, will find dignity and greatness and peace again.
author: Noel Coward

quote: To be a Bond girl you need courage, charm, determination and feistiness.
author: Olga Kurylenko

quote: We are in the midst of a momentous catastrophe of world history, of a transformation of all aspects of life and of the entire inner human being This is perhaps fortunate for the artistic person, if he is strong enough to bear the consequences, because what we need is the courage to have inner experience.
author: Walter Gropius

quote: The power of the human spirit inspires me. Movies, books, stories, people, anything that reminds us that we are more than just this physical body and our capacity for love and courage can bend reality.
author: Caity Lotz

quote: I think my mother... made it clear that you have to live life by your own terms and you have to not worry about what other people think and you have to have the courage to do the unexpected.
author: Caroline Kennedy

quote: If I have brought any message today, it is this: Have the courage to have your wisdom regarded as stupidity. Be fools for Christ. And have the courage to suffer the contempt of the sophisticated world.
author: Antonin Scalia

quote: Everyone has talent. What is rare is the courage to follow the talent to the dark place where it leads.
author: Erica Jong

quote: The joy of style lies not in how we look to other people, but in how we look to ourselves - and the most memorable and beautiful outfits are simply those that, in some rare moment of joy, we found the courage to share with the world.
author: Simon Van Booy

quote: One man scorned and covered with scars still strove with his last ounce of courage to reach the unreachable stars and the world will be better for this.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Believe in individual initiatives, in courage, in risk.
author: Emmanuel Macron

quote: He who loses wealth loses much he who loses a friend loses more but he that loses his courage loses all.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Innovation is so hard and so frustrating; it takes the intersections of people with courage, vision, and resources.
author: Dean Kamen

quote: We need the compassion and the courage to change the conditions that support our suffering. Those conditions are things like ignorance, bitterness, negligence, clinging, and holding on.
author: Sharon Salzberg

quote: I want to grow old without facelifts. I want to have the courage to be loyal to the face I have made.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: I have always had the courage for the new things that life sometimes offers.
author: Wallis Simpson

quote: Peace comes when you talk to the guy you most hate. And that's where the courage of a leader comes, because when you sit down with your enemy, you as a leader must already have very considerable confidence from your own constituency.
author: Desmond Tutu

quote: Have the courage to act instead of react.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quote: Courage is doing what you are afraid to do. There can be no courage unless you are scared.
author: Eddie Rickenbacker

quote: We have to confront ourselves. Do we like what we see in the mirror? And, according to our light, according to our understanding, according to our courage, we will have to say yea or nay - and rise!
author: Maya Angelou

quote: When everything goes wrong, what a joy to test your soul and see if it has endurance and courage. An invisible and all-powerful enemy - some call him God, others the Devil, seem to rush upon us to destroy us; but we are not destroyed.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

quote: Just remaining quietly in the presence of God, listening to Him, being attentive to Him, requires a lot of courage and know-how.
author: Thomas Merton

quote: Courage is the ladder on which all the other virtues mount.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

quote: No man in the world has more courage than the man who can stop after eating one peanut.
author: Channing Pollock

quote: I have the courage of my convictions.
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: We must remind Americans that the promise of opportunity remains unbroken - that every person in this great nation can succeed through hard work, courage and personal responsibility.
author: Brian Sandoval

quote: I have seen in the Halls of Congress more idealism, more humanness, more compassion, more profiles of courage than in any other institution that I have ever known.
author: Hubert H. Humphrey

quote: It often takes more courage to change one's opinion than to keep it.
author: Willy Brandt

quote: We need to find the courage to say no to the things and people that are not serving us if we want to rediscover ourselves and live our lives with authenticity.
author: Barbara De Angelis

quote: Often times I have been asked about the attributes for success, and I have said that you need two attributes for succeeding as an entrepreneur: one, courage, second, luck.
author: N. R. Narayana Murthy

quote: I can muster up the courage in the difficult situations to get me through.
author: Megyn Kelly

quote: Suffering! We owe to it all that is good in us, all that gives value to life; we owe to it pity, we owe to it courage, we owe to it all the virtues.
author: Anatole France

quote: It takes both courage and talent to stand up in front of fellow human beings and make them crack a smile, and at the same time keep it clean.
author: Ray Comfort

quote: It takes as much courage to have tried and failed as it does to have tried and succeeded.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Every human being on this earth is born with a tragedy, and it isn't original sin. He's born with the tragedy that he has to grow up... a lot of people don't have the courage to do it.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: Success, they taught me, is built on the foundation of courage, hard-work and individual responsibility. Despite what some would have us believe, success is not built on resentment and fears.
author: Susana Martinez

quote: Valor lies just halfway between rashness and cowardice.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Courage consists not in blindly overlooking danger, but in seeing it, and conquering it.
author: Jean Paul

quote: What is more mortifying than to feel that you have missed the plum for want of courage to shake the tree?
author: Logan Pearsall Smith

quote: True courage is a result of reasoning. A brave mind is always impregnable.
author: Jeremy Collier

quote: Courage can't see around corners but goes around them anyway.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: Men was formed for society, and is neither capable of living alone, nor has the courage to do it.
author: William Blackstone

quote: The courage of very ordinary people is all that stands between us and the dark.
author: Pam Brown

quote: One of the hardest questions I have been asked is 'How will you manage the army if you are having menstrual cramps?' I have also been asked if I will have the courage to face criminals. My answer is that courage is not a matter of gender.
author: Josefina Vazquez Mota

quote: Americans are gathering the courage to just say no. We are saying no to addictive consumer lifestyles. We are saying no to wars and corporate takeover and the IMF loans that gobble up people and their resources.
author: Cynthia McKinney

quote: When I write, what I long for is not more realism or fiction but more courage. That's what I always find myself short on and what I have to struggle to achieve in order that the work might live.
author: Junot Diaz

quote: I believe the biggest challenge is just getting the courage to try something different or new. Try to forget the stereotype in your mind. Yoga is for everyone - children, athletes, moms, dads, accountants, truck drivers, even country stars.
author: Kristian Bush

quote: When our mothers are alive and healthy, they do extraordinary things... like the mothers of Plaza de Mayo, who marched in Argentinean plazas, defying the military junta dictatorship and demanding the whereabouts of their abducted children... or the Liberian mothers who faced down civil war armed only with T-shirts and courage.
author: Liya Kebede

quote: The word 'courage,' one of my favorite words, the root or the etymology of that word is 'cour,' which means heart. I think true courage is actually following your heart and not getting or succumbing to what other people's definition of what your life should be. Live your life.
author: Hill Harper

quote: Having the courage to say no when all your friends are saying yes is one of the most difficult things you'll ever have to do. Doing it, however, is one of the biggest charges you can ever make to your personal battery. I call this 'won't power.'
author: Sean Covey

quote: War isn't just about bravery and courage and jingoism and patriotism. It's also fundamentally about grief. And the people that go and do the fighting and the dying are never the people who actually benefit from the fighting and the dying.
author: Russell Crowe

quote: Everywhere I go, I always look for creative entrepreneurs, whether it's artisans and craftsmen, small farmers and gardeners, or restaurateurs who use fresh, locally sourced ingredients. I admire the courage and self-reliance it takes to start your own business and make it succeed.
author: Martha Stewart

quote: Based on my experience, I believe that Ben Sasse has the right policy background, a notable commitment to public service - and, perhaps most importantly, the courage - to help renew our country.
author: Jeff Fortenberry

quote: The younger you are, the more courage and audacity you will have to set long-term goals and be there to personally work towards your vision. You will have the confidence to take risks because you have time by your side. You can bring innovation into everything you do and constantly reinvent yourself.
author: Shiv Nadar

quote: Grave was the man in years, in looks, in word, his locks were grey, yet was his courage green.
author: Torquato Tasso

quote: Our situation today shows that beauty demands for itself at least as much courage and decision as do truth and goodness, and she will not allow herself to be separated and banned from her two sisters without taking them along with herself in an act of mysterious vengeance.
author: Hans Urs von Balthasar

quote: Although most executives pay lip service to the idea of hiring for cultural fit, few have the courage or discipline to make it the primary criteria for bringing someone into the company.
author: Patrick Lencioni

quote: The truth won't set us free - until we develop the skills and the habit and the talent and the moral courage to use it.
author: Margaret Heffernan

quote: When I was younger, I was kind of fearless. I think it takes more courage to do things when you know more. I was completely naive, and I was like, 'Why can't I do anything I want to do?'
author: Carole King

quote: More firm and sure the hand of courage strikes, when it obeys the watchful eye of caution.
author: James Thomson

quote: Resignation is the courage of Christian sorrow.
author: Alexandre Vinet

quote: There is in true beauty, as in courage, something which narrow souls cannot dare to admire.
author: William Congreve

quote: As a shame researcher, I know that the very best thing to do in the midst of a shame attack is totally counterintuitive: Practice courage and reach out!
author: Brene Brown

quote: It requires greater courage to preserve inner freedom, to move on in one's inward journey into new realms, than to stand defiantly for outer freedom. It is often easier to play the martyr, as it is to be rash in battle.
author: Rollo May

quote: Courage is not the absence of despair; it is, rather, the capacity to move ahead in spite of despair.
author: Rollo May

quote: Courage is the capacity to confront what can be imagined.
author: Leo Rosten

quote: The only courage that matters is the kind that gets you from one moment to the next.
author: Mignon McLaughlin

quote: Courage and conviction are powerful weapons against an enemy who depends only on fists or guns. Animals know when you are afraid a coward knows when you are not.
author: David Seabury

quote: You have to really be courageous about your instincts and your ideas. Otherwise you'll just knuckle under, and things that might have been memorable will be lost.
author: Francis Ford Coppola

quote: I feel quite fearless protecting the people I love.
author: Paloma Faith

quote: Have the courage to be ignorant of a great number of things, in order to avoid the calamity of being ignorant of everything.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: The courage to imagine the otherwise is our greatest resource, adding color and suspense to all our life.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: There is nothing in the world so much admired as a man who knows how to bear unhappiness with courage.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: If we are to survive, we must have ideas, vision, and courage. These things are rarely produced by committees. Everything that matters in our intellectual and moral life begins with an individual confronting his own mind and conscience in a room by himself.
author: Arthur M. Schlesinger, Jr.

quote: The paradox of courage is that a man must be a little careless of his life even in order to keep it.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: To persevere, trusting in what hopes he has, is courage in a man.
author: Euripides

quote: Courage enlarges, cowardice diminishes resources. In desperate straits the fears of the timid aggravate the dangers that imperil the brave.
author: Christian Nestell Bovee

quote: The amount of eccentricity in a society has generally been proportional to the amount of genius, mental vigor, and moral courage it contained. That so few now dare to be eccentric marks the chief danger of the time.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Support the strong, give courage to the timid, remind the indifferent, and warn the opposed.
author: Whitney M. Young

quote: My talent is such that no undertaking, however vast in size... has ever surpassed my courage.
author: Peter Paul Rubens

quote: Greatness, in the last analysis, is largely bravery - courage in escaping from old ideas and old standards and respectable ways of doing things.
author: James Harvey Robinson

quote: I would kiss you, had I the courage.
author: Edouard Manet

quote: Your determination, selflessness and courage have brought the freedom struggle towards its fulfilment.
author: Gerry Adams

quote: Rosa Parks' courage, determination, and tenacity continue to be an inspiration to all those committed to non-violent protest and change nearly half a century later.
author: Bob Filner

quote: One of the things that makes Hamlet unique among Shakespeare's characters is his courage to face up to the darker elements of his personality.
author: Kenneth Branagh

quote: Courage stands halfway between cowardice and rashness, one of which is a lack, the other an excess of courage.
author: Plutarch

quote: It is a wise man who knows where courage ends and stupidity begins.
author: Jerome Cady

quote: Traits like humility, courage, and empathy are easily overlooked - but it's immensely important to find them in your closest relationships.
author: Laura Linney

quote: I think that the romantic impulse is in all of us and that sometimes we live it for a short time, but it's not part of a sensible way of living. It's a heroic path and it generally ends dangerously. I treasure it in the sense that I believe it's a path of great courage. It can also be the path of the foolhardy and the compulsive.
